wikipedia_page.main: Colonel George Thomas Clark (26 May 1809 – 31 January 1898) was a British surgeon and engineer. He was particularly associated with the management of the Dowlais Iron Company. He was also an antiquary and historian of Glamorgan.

response: Detailed drawings and plans prepared by the engineer and antiquary George Thomas Clark in 1871, and subsequently by George Lambert in 1901, assisted the Royal Commission on the Ancient and Historical Monuments of Wales (RCAHMW) in their survey of the castle published in 2000. In this survey, RCAHMW described the development of the castle in six phases: Period 1, the late-12th century; Period 2, the early-14th century; Period 3, the late-15th century; Period 4, the early-16th century; Period 5, the late-16th or early-17th centuries and finally the restorations of Carne, Williams and Hearst. The survey identified "substantial" remnants of the original Norman enceinte, including the keep, which had been enveloped by later developments and had previously been unrecognised and unrecorded.
*George Thomas Clark (1809–1898), civil engineer and antiquary, Manager, Dowlais Ironworks, 1855–1897

The accompanied text was written by the engineer George Thomas Clark,B. Ll. James, ‘Clark, George Thomas (1809–1898)’, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 accessed 18 Feb 2014 and in those days was discussed in multiple sourcesJaarboekje van wetenschappen en kunsten. Vol. 1. Nijgh, 1847. p 31The Year-book of Facts in Science and Art. Lockwood & Company, 1847. p. 7Anna Maria Hall (1847) Sharpe's London magazine, a journal of entertainment and instruction. p. 19 The volume of Bourne's work was reproduced in 1969.

Matters were put on foot in India by Sir George Arthur, 1st Baronet as governor of Bombay, who brought in George Thomas Clark to make an initial survey, to benefit the cotton trade. Chapman's role was to co-ordinate Bombay and London. He landed at Bombay in September 1845 to make preliminary investigations. He returned home in 1846 with his plans and his report completed.
